awd_titl_txt: Conference: Academy of Management CTO Doctoral Consortium
awd_abstract_narration:
This award supports a diverse group of approximately 25 dissertation-stage students at U.S. institutions to participate in an international doctoral consortium with distinguished research faculty. The Communication, Digital Technology, and Organization (CTO) doctoral consortium at the 2022 Academy of Management (AoM) conference will consist of one and a half days of talks and interactions among OCIS students and researchers in Seattle, Washington. The doctoral consortium provides students with feedback on their work from other students and faculty members, allowing them to enhance their own dissertation research proposals. Additionally, because of the diversity of the business sub-disciplines and communities involved in the AoM conference, the consortium will allow students to establish research connections beyond their own disciplines. Consequently, participation will allow students to develop a better understanding of the different research communities, which will facilitate their participation in future interdisciplinary research and their progress toward becoming professional researchers.
 
The CTO division at the annual AoM meeting provides a leading international forum for the presentation and discussion of research and practical issues related to the use and impact of information and communication technologies in organizations and society. This project provides a forum for doctoral students to exchange insights and receive feedback and guidance in order to enhance the quality of their dissertation research. It also facilitates the establishment of new research collaborations and professional networks and develops a greater awareness of ongoing cutting-edge research in the field of organizational communication and information systems.

This award reflects NSF's statutory mission and has been deemed worthy of support through evaluation using the Foundation's intellectual merit and broader impacts review criteria.
org_dir_long_name: Directorate for Computer and Information Science and Engineering

inst.org_lgl_bus_name: UNIVERSITY OF NOTRE DAME DU LAC

por.por_cntn:
The project involved supporting dissertaion-stage PhD students at U.S. institutions to attend a Doctoral Consortium at the Academy of Management's Conference with the Communications, Digital Technology and Organizations (CTO) Division. The Academy of Management Conference is the world's largest interdisciplinary management conference. The CTO division is an interdisciplinary community focused on the intersection of computing technologies (data, software, AI, and computational methods) and the human side of organizations (behavior, social context, economics, operations, processes, strategies). 

The doctoral consortium provided students with three opportunities to present their work - two different small group roundtables and a poster session with over two hundred attendees. These presentations allowed them to get feedback on their work from other students and faculty mentors, which helped to enhance their dissertation research. During the session mentors focused on professional preparation in this interdiscipinary field, and there were multiple networking opportunities with peers. Additionally, because of the diversity of the business sub-disciplines and communities involved in the AOM conference, participation allowed students to develop a better understanding of the different research communities, which will facilitate their participation in future interdisciplinary research. 

Overall student participant response was highly positive. Participants unanimously indicated that the session strengthened their dissertation research, their professional preparation, and their networks. All participants strongly agreed that they would recommend the doctoral consortium to others.

 


Last Modified: 02/08/2023
Modified by: Nicholas Berente
